storySections.heading: Ethereum as trustworthy social infrastructure
body: Alignment between specs and implementations, predictable state transitions and value transfers, and third-party verifiability—these are the conditions for a trustworthy social infrastructure.

On such a foundation, smart contracts don’t rely on specific intermediaries: they codify promises and keep them verifiably. Excessive intermediation shrinks, inefficiencies from market dominance are curbed, and barriers to entry drop. As a result, anyone, anywhere can experiment, compose, and scale new value under fair rules—and we contribute to building that foundation.

storySections.heading: Why we do this
body: Ethereum is a meritocratic arena where background—education, ethnicity, age, affiliation—matters less than proven skill and outcomes. Open discussion and review, public implementations, and permissionless contribution define the culture. We are a small, young team drawn to that ethos, focused on better implementations and sound verification for the benefit of both users and developers.

faqSection.heading: FAQ

items.question: Is Nyx Foundation a nonprofit?
items.answer: Yes. Nyx Foundation is a non-profit general incorporated association in Japan. We do not distribute profits; any surplus is allocated as funding for research, formal verification, and community contributions.

items.question: How is my donation used?
items.answer: We fund research and formal verification, vulnerability research and fixes, applied work on MEV and mechanism design, and the operational base. Even small PRs and single proofs help prevent incidents over time and raise reliability.

items.question: Can I get a receipt?
items.answer: Yes, on request. We don’t issue receipts automatically for every donation. If you need one, please contact us via the form or at contact@nyx.foundation. For bank transfers or crypto, we issue after confirming receipt.
